page.title: 02 MIDDLETON PARK
page.content: Middleton Park stands on the original site of the earlier Manor house(s).It was built in 1938 and was designed by Sir Edwin and Mr:Robert Lutyens.The entrance hall is similar in design to the Viceroy's residence in Delhi(INDIA).The house is seperate from the Jersey Estate and is owned by the Davenport family.The grounds are limited by the 'Ha-Ha'(an empty ditch).The rear of the house faces south with open views of the surrounding countryside.All the windows on the south side are shuttered and a special feature was two low-level windows (for the children to look out)called nurseries.The dumbbells,a Lutyens feature, were carved in stone outside and wood inside.Another impressive feature is the teak finished staircase.The house is not open to the public.
